intro: Coccothrinax cupularis, commonly known as the Cuban palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the island of Cuba and is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that develop into dark blue, fleshy fruits. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
